SENT.plain: A 28-year-old male was diagnosed as aplastic anemia in 1983
He maintained on corticosterone with a large transfusion requirement for being resistant to other therapies, and combined with hemochromatosis at 20-year-old
In February 1994, he was admitted to the hospital for consideration of BMT
He was transplanted with bone marrow from his HLA-matched MLC negative sister following contained of TLI (7.5 Gy) and CY 50 mg/kg for four days on March 10 1994
Disturbance of consciousness appeared, an echocardiogram showed severe pericardial effusion on day 1 after BMT
He was diagnosed cardiac tamponade, pericardiocentesis was done immediately and 100 ml pericardial effusion was removed
Transiently he became alert, however, irreversible cardiac arrest occurred on day 2
Postmortem examination revealed thickened left ventricles with intramyocardial hemorrhage
It seems necessary to reduce CY, or substitute it with anti-thymocyte globulin (ATG) or TBI etc. for BMT in aplastic anemia accompanied by hemochromatosis
